jdd

Class SanityJDD

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdd.SanityJDD

  • public class SanityJDD
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for doing sanity checks in the symbolic engines.
    As the sanity checks perform various MTBDD operations, which can be costly and can lead to a significant slow-down, the sanity checks should only be enabled for debugging purposes.
    The sanity checks are globally enabled by setting the static boolean enabled to true.
    In your code, check this variable before calling one of the check methods. However, the methods themselves do not check the enabled flag and can therefore also be used when the global sanity check is disabled.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean enabled
      Global flag: is sanity checking enabled?

      static void check(boolean value, java.lang.String message)
      Generic check method, raise error with the given message if value is false
      static void checkIsContainedIn(JDDNode a, JDDNode b)
      Perform sanity check: Is a contained in b?
      a and b have to be 0/1 MTBDDs.
      static void checkIsDDOverVars(JDDNode node, JDDVars... allowedVars)
      Perform sanity check: Ensure that node has no relevant variables outside of the allowedVars.
      static void checkIsStateSet(JDDNode node, JDDVars vars)
      Perform sanity check: Ensure that node is a state set over the given state variables.
      static void checkIsZeroOneMTBDD(JDDNode node)
      Perform sanity check: Is node a 0/1-MTBDD, i.e., has only 0 and 1 as constants.
      static void checkVarsAreSorted(JDDVars vars)
      Perform sanity check: Are the variable indizes for the vars vector in increasing order?
      This is an assumption for various methods taking a list of variables as argument.
      private static void error(java.lang.String message)
      Throw error
